EVENT.TITLE: Bug Spot
EVENT.DESCRIPTION: Bug spot, the on-spot debugging contest is not only about programming talent but also about applying the sheer knowledge to rectify errors. The challenge tests a programmer's ability to understand and respond to dissimilar codes. The art of rectification / debugging is difficult than conventional programming because it's not about what you know, it's about how much you know and how you apply those cognitive ideas to recognize errors and act upon them. The event tests the programmer in areas of speed, intellect and understanding.
EVENT.RULES:
1.   Programming languages used will be C and Java.
2.   A group can have maximum of 3 members.
Rounds
1st ROUND- Will consist of 50 MCQs related to basic programming knowledge, duration of which will be 1 hour.
2nd ROUND- Will consist of Maximum 10 Subjective debugging questions, where participants have to spot the Bug and suggest a solution.
In case of any discrepancy, decision of event organizers will be final.
EVENT.TIMELINE:
1.   1st Round will be held on 12th November, 2016.
2.   2nd Round is scheduled on 13 November, 2016.
3.   Event timings will be informed prior to Infotsav.

EVENT.TITLE: Code Rush
EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
Do you feel compelled to demystify the truth? Do you have a knack for solving problems? The online programming contest is here for you . Show off your programming skills and let your rusty gears jingle in the disco of grey cells. After all, life doesn't give a second chance. So face your opponent in the battlefield and prove yourself a great warrior.
This year also a set of demanding problems awaits one and the standard has only got tougher and tougher. In this grueling test the more one solves, the higher he or she scores.
The code-crazy enthusiasts are invited to be a part of this mega event at CODECHEF (A Directi Educational Initiative). So, all the participants are requested to get registered on http://www.codechef.com prior to the commencement of the contest. Permitted languages to provide solution are C, C++ and Java. The details of the contest are as follows.
This mega event will be hosted at CODECHEF (A Directi Educational Initiative).
So, all the participants are requested to register on the hosting website www.codechef.com prior to the commencement of the contest. All the participants also have to be registered on www.infotsav.org with the same codechef handle to be eligible for the prizes.
Permitted languages to provide solution are C, C++ and Java.
Only students who are studying in graduate and post-graduate level in any Indian university are eligible for the prizes. Professionals can participate but are not eligible for the prizes.
Please do not discuss strategy, suggestions or tips in the comments during a live contest. If you are unsure, email us at coderush@infotsav.org.
You will receive one point for solving a problem (passing all test cases - no partial credit), regardless of the level of difficulty of that problem.
You can submit solutions as many times as you'd like, there are no penalties for incorrect submissions. Users are ranked according to the most problems solved. Ties will be broken by the total time for each user in ascending order of time.

Any participant found having fake information regarding qualification criteria or profile information shall be immediately disqualified.
After the end of the contest, the test cases and the author's solution would be available on the page www.facebook.com/Coderush.Infotsav.
Any sort of malicious activity will lead to immediate disqualification of the participant in question.

The decision of the organizers in declaring the results will be final and will be binding to all. No queries in this regard will be entertained.
EVENT.RULES:
1.  Please do not discuss strategy, suggestions or tips in the comments during a live contest. Posting questions clarifying the problem statement is ok. If you are unsure, email us at feedback@codechef.com  .
2.  Discussing CodeChef's problems or any aspect of problem, on any other platform on web, on identification, could lead to disabling of respective account and banning from the community.
3.  Almost all languages supported on CodeChef are allowed.
4.  Each program will be tested based on our critical test data. However output and input should be exactly as specified in the samples provided
5.  Please contact aditiagarwal@gmail.com or sinhashivam0406@gmail.com for any queries during the contest.
Judging Criteria:
 1.  All the problems have same points alloted to them.
2.  Users are ranked according to the most problems solved.
3.  You can submit solutions as many times as you'd like, there are no penalties for incorrect submissions. Only your first correct submission will be considered.
4.  The total time is the sum of the time consumed for each problem solved.
The decision of the organizers in declaring the results will be final. No queries in this regard will be entertained.
5. Any participant found to be indulging in any form of malpractice will be immediately disqualified.

EVENT.TITLE: Techathlon
EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
In the era of increasing efficiency, one has to multitask to reach his destined glory. For all the code maniacs out there who are ready for a coding extravaganza, Infotsav, this year is conducting Techathlon. From an Aptitude test in your own college, through an online coding round, to various onsite events at ABV-IIITM, Techathlon, at every stage, will put your knowledge, skills as well as logical ability to test. It is a 4-event technical extravaganza consisting of:-
Algorithm Writing
Bugspot
CodeRush
Code Stumble
EVENT.RULES:
</br>1. TECHATHLON consists of 4 open-to-all events. </br>2. The participants should be the students of any IIIT.
</br>3. Every member needs to participate in at least one of the above mentioned events. </br>4. No member can be in two TECHATHLON team. </br>5. Ties will be dealt with the scores of Code Rush. </br>6. The score of each event will be normalized. The contribution of each event will be disclosed two weeks before the fest. </br>8. Disqualification from any event due to use of unfair means can lead to disqualification from whole TECHATHLON series.
EVENT.TIMELINE: </br>1. The first stage for qualifying to TECHATHLON would be an aptitude test conducted in their own Institutes. </br>2. Second stage will be an online coding event. </br>3. The first 2 teams from each college to qualify the second stage will be eligible to participate in TECHATHLON.

EVENT.TITLE: Hackathon
EVENT.DESCRIPTION: HACKATHON is one such event which promises to fill the veins of the audience with adrenaline and will make your knowledge cross all the borders. It’s an event in which the programmers and developers all around the globe to come together and collaboratively design and develop new apps or ideas and solutions to real life problems using latest technologies. Creative thinking inspires ideas and ideas in turn inspires change. This is sole motto of hackathon in which one needs to dive into particular data sets, problems or concepts and come out with a great innovative solution to one. The solution can be such as building a new data visualization, writing a document, presenting a code, developing an app or collaboratively investigating a problem.
EVENT.RULES:

  • 9.  Participants will be judged on their Innovation and Creativity.
  • 10.  Participants need to register to the event. Theme of the contest will be announced 10 days prior to fest. Participants need to work on the clip and present it.

EVENT.TITLE: Code Stumble
EVENT.DESCRIPTION: Because writing code for a problem statement can be too mainstream, we have come up with an amalgamation of coding and reverse engineering skills. A two phase event which requires you to write a complete, working and complex code for a given problem statement in the first phase and then frame the problem statement for the code written by your competitors in the second phase. Make your code tough for others to understand in first phase and understand the gist of your competitor's code in second phase to maximize your chances of winning. "Your problem is your competitor's solution, your solution is your competitor's problem."
EVENT.RULES:
• 1.  Event Structure:   Rounds:
    Round 1: Coding
    Round 2: Decipher the code
  • 2.  Languages Allowed – C/C++ , JAVA
  • 3.   Team Size – Maximum of 3 members
  • 4.  The participants must reach the venue well before time.
  • 5.   For Round 1, participants will be provided with a computer
  • 6.   A 15 minute break will be provided to participants between the 2 rounds.
  • 7.  Participants must adhere to the time limit.
  • 8.  Use of any unfair means will lead to disqualification of the team.
  • 9.  Use of internet is strictly prohibited.
  • 10.  No responsibility will be held by Infotsav, IIITM Gwalior for any late or lost entries or other such situations.
  • 11.  Decision of the organizing committee will be final and binding.
EVENT.TIMELINE:
Round 1 : Coding
Objective
1.  Write a program to solve a given problem statement.
2.  The program should run on all test cases provided beforehand.
3.  Time Limit
45 minutes
Round 2 : Decipher the Code
Objective
1.  Decipher your competitor’s code and frame the problem statement for it.
2.  Print the output of given test cases.
3.  Time Limit
30 minutes
Judging Criteria
1.  A = Time taken to code in Round 1. (Max 45)
2.  B = Time taken to decipher the code in Round 2 (Max 30)
3.  F(x) = 4*A + 3*B (Max 270)
4.  Score = (1 / (1 + F(x)))*100

EVENT.TITLE: Sameeksha
EVENT.DESCRIPTION: The Annual Paper Presentation Conference is intended to encourage students to prepare and present meaningful papers and presentations on subjects relating to various domains (Technical & Non-Technical).Researching, writing, and presenting a paper provides a student with invaluable early experience in expressing ideas related to its research area.
EVENT.RULES:
The rules governing the competition are as follows:
  • 1.   The competition is open to School students, undergraduates, postgraduates and research scholars.
  • 2.  Maximum number of participants in a Team is 4.
  • 3.  The topics that the papers need to be based on are suggestive. It is advisable that the presentation focuses on one particular topic.
  • 4.  Abstract should not exceed 150-300 words and the whole Paper should not exceed 20 pages.
  • 5.   The length of the paper should be between 1000 and 3000 words, not including the abstract, figures or tables.
  • 6.   The oral presentation must not be more than ten minutes in length. Upon conclusion of each presentation, two additional minutes will be allowed for questions, for a total of twelve minutes.
  • 7.  Bring your college I-Card on the event day.
  • 8.   Please bring your PowerPoint presentation on a CD or in a pen-drive.
  • 9.   Soft-copies of the submitted paper and PowerPoint presentations must be in the .pdf format.
  • 10.  Please Mail your abstract, paper and PowerPoint presentation to sameeksha@infotsav.com. Difficulties will be addressed through the same email-id.
  • 11.   Please bring 2 hardcopies of the submitted paper on the day of the event.
  • 12.   Persons from different institutions can be a part of the same team. However, one person may not be a part of multiple teams for the same event.
EVENT.TIMELINE:
• 1.   The mail with submissions should contain:
    a. Title- theme of the paper
    b. Name of both the authors (with Institute’s name)
    c. Contact no. of both the authors
    d. E- Mail ID
  • 2.   Last day to submit soft copy of your report (via e-mail) will be seven days prior to the day of presentation.
  • 3.   After you have submitted the soft copy, a panel of judges will go through your material and if you are shortlisted to give the presentation, you will be notified.
  • 4.  The abstract mail should contain abstract, references, your e-mail id and mobile number.
  • 5.   The decision of judges will be final and no arguments or appeal will be entertained.

EVENT.TITLE: Brandsome
EVENT.DESCRIPTION: Brandsome is the advertising contest that is held under Infotsav. It is a noisy clamorous response to stimulus produced by crowd. It can also refer to reaction expressed over a period of time to an event. Advertising is a form of communication that typically attempts to persuade potential customers to purchase or to consume more of a particular brand of product or service. Advertisements are designed to generate increased consumption of those products and services through the creation and reinforcement of "brand image" and "brand loyalty". Every major medium is used to deliver these messages, including television, radio, cinema, magazines, newspapers, video games, the Internet and billboards. This art of emphasizing desirable qualities so as to arouse a desire to buy has been molded in this event Brandsome.
EVENT.RULES:
Technical requirements:
1.  Image submissions should meet the following requirements:
Colored
2.  Maximum size of 1920 X 1080 px
3.  Horizontal or vertical orientation
4.  In .jpeg , .jpg , .png format
5.  With a limit of 5MB per image.
1.  The video advertisement should not be more than 40 seconds long and should be in .mpg, .avi or .flv format.
2.  In Video advertisement, flash presentation is also allowed.
3.  The audio advertisement should not be more than 20 seconds long and should be in .mp3 or .mp4 format.
Rules and Regulations:
1.  The maximum size of a team is three.
2.  The number of teams that would be shortlisted for second phase will depend on the number of teams in the first phase.
3.  Teams participating without any unique id’s will not be judged.
4.  The print advertisements should be targeting newspapers and magazines.
5.  Once all submissions have been received, the judging and public voting phases for the competition will begin.
6.  Entries not adhering to the rules and criteria may be excluded from the competition, at the discretion of the jury. The jury’s decision is final and there is no appeal.
7.  In case of any discrepancy the organizers decisions will be final and no appeal from the participants will be entertained. . Copyright and patents:
8.  Submitted advertisement must be an original, unpublished work.
9.  The entrant is responsible for the contents of the advertisement which cannot include copyright protected material. The entrant must have the rights for all the texts and images used in the submitted work.
EVENT.TIMELINE:
Phase 1:
To participate in this Round the interested teams are requested to send their details on our mail.
It is an online elimination phase. The participants have to send their print advertisement in the given domain and if you are able to send audio or video advertisement on our email-id. Keep in your mind that the print advertisement is indispensable.
If you are fortunate enough to get through to first round you are eligible for phase2.
You will be adjudged on the decision of judges (print and audio/video entry) after 48 hours of commencement of the round.
Result will be published on our facebook page and the selected team will be intimated through mail.
Phase 2:
Top teams of round 1 will be called for round 2 which is on campus round and will held during INFOTSAV 2K16 .
To participate in round 2 the teams should register physically at ABV-IIITM.
In round 2 you will have to give the presentation on the given to topic.

Phase 3:
In this round, we will give you a topic and you have to prepare your brand and presentation for the same, after this you have to present your brand and presentation, and you can play skit which will be describe your brand also.

EVENT.TITLE: Pinnacle
EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
If you have a unique idea that carves you out as a successful entrepreneur, then we welcome you to the most appreciated event of Infotsav. It provides your idea, a platform and eventually a spark just sufficient to ignite you. So what are you waiting for? It's show time. Pinnacle is the flagship event of Infotsav'16 which is being conducted on 8th and 9th October 2016. The event is attracting students from the best B-schools and Engineering colleges around the country.
Prize Money
First Prize: Rs.15000
Second Prize: Rs.10000
EVENT.RULES:
There is no registration fee.
  • 1.  Executive Summary and all other documents/queries to be sent to pinnacle@infotsav.com
  • 2.  A team should comprise of a maximum of 4 members.
  • 3.  Strictly adhere to the format mentioned below.
  • 4.  Students and working professional from different institutes/organizations can come together to form team(s).
  • 5.  Any identified act of plagiarism will be immediately disqualified. All conflicts subject to the jurisdiction of Gwalior Court only.
  • 6.  The teams should strictly adhere to the deadlines mentioned.
  • 7.  The decision of the judges and organizers will be final and binding to all the participants.
  • 8.  Any of the terms and conditions can be changed by the organizers anytime ensuring to give the participants appropriate time to respond to the changes.

EVALUATION CRITERIA
  • 1.  The clarity and potential of the market opportunity.
  • 2.  Innovativeness of business concept.
  • 3.  Feasibility of the plan.
  • 4.  The overall evaluation of potential reward to risk.
  • 5.  Marketing Strategy.
  • 6.  Financial Analysis.
  • 7.  Sustainability & Scalability of Business Model.
  • 8.  Quality of presentation.
EVENT.TIMELINE:
Phase 1: Executive Summary Submission (Online)
Last date for submission: 20th September 2016.
Entries submitted after the deadlines will not be considered.
The Executive Summary will be submitted online in the PDF format only.
The PDF file can have a maximum of five pages excluding the cover page. . The pdf should be mailed to pinnacle@infotsav.com
Format for submission of Executive summary:
I. COVER SLIDE
  • A) Each entry should have a cover slide stating the Team Information of each member stated below:
    Name
    Contact No
    Email-id
  • B) The cover page must also contain the Project/B-Plan name, team name and the name of the institution.
  • C) No reference of team members or their company/college is allowed anywhere in the executive summary except the cover slide.
II. DETAILS
The details of the executive summary should be in the following format:
  • A.   The Purpose of the Plan
    1.   The problem you are trying to solve through your plan
    2.  Innovativeness of your idea (USP)
  • B.   Market Analysis
    1.   The characteristics of your target market (demographic, geographic, etc.)
    2.   The products or services you will offer to satisfy those needs
  • C.   The Company
    1.   The needs your company will satisfy
    2.   The products or services you will offer to satisfy those needs
  • D.  Marketing and Sales Activities
    1.  Marketing strategy
    2.   Sales strategy
    3.   Keys to success in your competitive environment
  • E.   Organization and Personnel
    1.  Key managers and owners
    2.   Key operations employees
  • F.   Financial Data
    1.   Funds required and their use
    2.   Prospective financial summary (including a brief justification for prospective sales levels)
  • Results of selected Executive Summaries
  • Will be declared latest by 25th September 2016
Phase 2: Presentation of final Business plans (On Campus)
The shortlisted teams will be invited on the campus for the presentation of their Final Business Plans.
15 minutes (13 minutes for presentation & 2 minutes for binding) will be allotted to every team to showcase their complete B-Plan to the Judges.
Time constraints are to be strictly followed otherwise negative marking will be followed.
Teams are restricted to use Microsoft Power Point for presentations.
*The above mentioned dates are less likely to be changed or get delayed.
* For more details check www.infotsav.com

EVENT.TITLE: ROBO WAR
EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
Robo Wars is a real-time arcade game in which two opponents would be competing with their manually operated robots with the objective of immobilizing each other. The last robot standing would be the winner.Robo war will be held in two categories,namely :-

Robo War - The bots with weight between 20-40 kgs and size 60cm x 60cm x 80cm are eligible for this category.

Mini Robo War - The bots with weight less than 20 kgs and size 30cm x 30cm x 30cm are eligible for this category.

Two bots will fight against each other in the arena. Their aim will be to overpower among opponents and throw them out of the arena, drop into the pit made in the arena. It will have fixed time duration.

EVENT.TITLE: Enigma
EVENT.DESCRIPTION: A quiz is usually a form of a student assessment, but has fewer questions of lesser difficulty and requires less time for completion than a test. It is to celebrate this spirit that Infotsav conducts Enigma. Enigma will have a preliminary round of offline quiz and only the top scoring teams will compete in the mains, to be the best. So brace up yourself to be a part of techno- managerial quiz contest to compete with the best brains of the youth. This is the war of grey cells. So let us watch who meets the target superbly! We need your cooperation to move ahead in taking it to another level and achieve unfathomable level of excellence and popularity.
EVENT.TIMELINE:
The Enigma Quiz will consist of three rounds:-
  • 1.   Qualifying Round- Each team would be given a set of question paper containing multiple choice objective type. This round will be pen paper based round. 15 teams will qualify for the next round. Time: 45 minutes
  • 2.  Elimination Round –This will be PPT based round. Only 5 teams would be selected for Elimination Round. Time: 30 minutes
  • 3.  Final Round – Top 5 teams will meet in this final round which consists of several sub-rounds. Time: 1 hr

EVENT.TITLE: Programmimg
EVENT.DESCRIPTION: A brain-storming session and test your coding skills; both the basics as well as the hidden lethal concepts of computer programming.
EVENT.TIMELINE:
The Programming Quiz will consist of three rounds:-
  • 1.  Qualifying Round- Each team would be given a set of question paper containing multiple choice objective type questions based on syntax and logical understanding. This round will be pen paper based round . 15 teams will qualify for the next round. Time: 45 minutes
  • 2.  Elimination Round –This will be PPT based round. Only 5 teams would be selected for Elimination Round. Time: 1 hr
  • 3.  Final Round – Top 5 teams will meet in this final round which consists of three sub-rounds. These sub-rounds are listed below. Time: 2 hr

Sub-rounds:
  • 1.  Buzzer Round: Each team will be provided with a buzzer. A set of questions will be asked and any team can answer it provided they hit the buzzer first. If the team answers correctly then they will be awarded points else adequate negative marking will be implied.
  • 2.  Jeopardy: Round will consist of a PowerPoint presentation format. There will be different set of questions, each having different points (based on their difficulty level). Each teams gets a chance to choose for which point question they would like to play. Each team will attempt one question at a time. The question once chosen by a team cannot be chosen back. Please note that the questions are initially hidden. The teams just need to choose on what point question they want to play. Once they choose then the question will be displayed. Negative marking will be there for almost all the question debarring few which are special questions. Special question can be of any kind for example some questions might not have negative marking or some question might have double points and so on.
  • 3.   Survival Round: Each team must attempt the question given to them. If answered wrong then one member of the team should leave which they will decide among themselves. The team having the last member standing while all the other teams will have no member remaining after different cycles of questions will win the round.
EVENT.CONTACTS:
Vaibhav Khandelwal

EVENT.TITLE: Anime Quiz
EVENT.DESCRIPTION: 'Otaku' is an trivia style anime quiz teams will compete each other ad answer questions from various anime shows featured on the weekly shonen jump and many more.
EVENT.RULES:
1.List of anime to be asked questions on:

  • 1.  Dragonball-Z
  • 2.  Naruto
  • 3.   Bleach
  • 4.   One Piece
  • 5.   Full Metal Alchemist
  • 6.   Tokyo Ghoul
  • 7.   Attack on Titans
EVENT.TIMELINE:
Anime quiz will proceed in Two steps
Round-1
Each team of at most 2 members will take on a quiz consisting of 30 MCQ style questions from above mentioned anime shows and the duration of quiz will be 30 mins.
Round-2
Top 6 teams who scored the highest in Round-1 will qualify to Round-2 which will be a on-stage 'Jeopardy' style quiz. The team having highest score will win. In case of tie a rapid fire round will take place to pick out the winner.
